title: Novel constructions of complex orthogonal designs for space-time block codes.
abstract: Complex orthogonal designs (CODs) are used to construct space-time block codes in wireless transmission. COD O z  with parameter [p, n, k] is a p × n matrix, where nonzero entries are filled by ±z i  or ±z i * , i = 1, 2, … , k, such that equation. In practice, n is the number of antennas, k=p the code rate, and p the decoding delay.
